definition: standard (unified) pronunciation of a character with multiple readings, as stipulated by the PRC Ministry of Education in 1985
to gather/to unite/to unify/whole
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
comma/phrase marked by pause
falling tone/fourth tone in modern Mandarin
variant Chinese character
loan character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character acquiring meanings by phonetic association/also called phonetic loan
pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
word having alternative pronunciations
character with two or more readings
evenly rising tone, the second tone of putonghua
alveolar/consonants z, c, s produced with the tip of the tongue on the alveolar ridge
variant pronunciation (when the same character has more than one reading)
(Chinese linguistics) zero initial (the initial of a syllable that does not begin with a consonant)
main vowel in diphthong
Hanyu Pinyin, the romanization system used in the PRC since the 1960s
entering tone/checked tone/one of the four tones of Middle Chinese
to indicate the pronunciation of Chinese characters using Pinyin or Bopomofo etc/phonetic notation/(specifically) Bopomofo (abbr. for 注音符號|注音符号[zhu4 yin1 fu2 hao4])

reading/pronunciation (of a Chinese character)
